thread.title: Man wanted for armed robbery in Assiniboia, Sask. apprehended by police | Globalnews.ca
thread.title_full: Man wanted for armed robbery in Assiniboia, Sask. apprehended by police | Globalnews.ca

author: Thomas Piller
title: Man wanted for armed robbery in Assiniboia, Sask. apprehended by police | Globalnews.ca
text:
February 7, 2017 5:30 pm Updated: February 7, 2017 5:45 pm Man wanted for armed robbery in Assiniboia, Sask. apprehended by police By Thomas Piller Online Producer Global News 
RCMP say Khaled Alnadi, 25, who was wanted for an armed robbery, was apprehended in Moose Jaw, Sask., on Tuesday. Supplied / Assiniboia RCMP What is this? 
Sponsored content is written by Global News' editorial staff without any editorial influence by the sponsor. If you'd like to learn more... X What is this? 
Sponsored content is written by Global News' without any editorial influence by the sponsor. If you'd like to learn more... - Listen 
Saskatchewan RCMP say Khaled Alnadi, 25, who was wanted for an armed robbery, has been apprehended. 
At around 12:40 p.m. CT on Tuesday, police and RCMP members located Alnadi at a Moose Jaw residence and took him into custody. 
Last week, Assiniboia RCMP obtained evidence during a traffic stop which resulted in charges against three Saskatchewan men. 
Alnadi and a 19-year-old man were charged for an armed robbery that took place at a business in Assiniboia on Jan .9. 
RCMP released this surveillance photo from the armed robbery in Assiniboia. Courtesy of RCMP 
RCMP officials announced on Monday that a warrant had been issued for Alnadiâ€™s arrest. 
He is facing charges that include cocaine trafficking, armed robbery, wearing a disguise with intent to commit a criminal offence, mischief under $5,000 and possession of a prohibited weapon. 
All three men facing charges are scheduled to appear in Assiniboia provincial court on Thursday. Related
